meanings.definition: The quality or state of having unlimited power or authority.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the king's almightinesses was evident as he made decisions for the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: Many people admire the almightinesses of the president in leading the country.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's almightinesses was put to the test when faced with a villain who could control minds.
meanings.sent4: Her almightinesses in the kitchen made her the go-to person for baking advice.
meanings.sent5: The almightinesses of nature's forces can be seen in the powerful hurricanes that form in the ocean.

meanings.definition: The belief in a deity or deities with supreme power.
meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization's almightinesses in multiple gods shaped their rituals and traditions.
meanings.sent2: Faith in the almightinesses of the divine brings comfort to many during difficult times.
meanings.sent3: Some people find humor in the almightinesses of the universe when things don't go as planned.
meanings.sent4: The almightinesses of the gods was compared to the strength of a thousand warriors.
meanings.sent5: The almightinesses of the deity was depicted in the grand temples built in its honor.

meanings.definition: The ability to do anything without limitations.
meanings.sent1: With his almightinesses, the magician amazed the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent2: The genie's almightinesses allowed him to grant any wish that was asked of him.
meanings.sent3: The child imagined having the almightinesses to fly like a bird in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her almightinesses in problem-solving made her the star of the math competition.
meanings.sent5: The almightinesses of technology have revolutionized the way we communicate with each other.
